content.question: Read the question carefully. You can receive full credit only by directly answering all aspects of the question. You must answer the question in essay form. An outline or bulleted list is not acceptable. (Note: This exam uses the chronological designations B.C.E. (before the common era) and C.E. (common era). These designations correspond to B.C. (before Christ) and A.D. (anno Domini), which are used in some art history resources.) The work shown is the frontispiece of the Codex Mendoza, created c. 1541–1542 C.E. Describe at least one element of the content of the frontispiece of the Codex Mendoza. Describe the audience for whom the Codex Mendoza was made. Using at least two examples of specific contextual evidence, explain how the content of the frontispiece of the Codex Mendoza was most likely intended to function for its intended audience. Using specific evidence, explain why the content of the frontispiece of the Codex Mendoza is important for understanding the likely meaning of the work for the people who created it.
